Sony Bank had a problem.
They are planning to start offering web3 services and stablecoin transactions.
The problem is that they are a regular bank and have to deal with regular bank regulations.
They also want to run web3 services now and web3 users want and demand privacy.
But instead of giving up one for the other, they choose both.

But how do they bridge that gap?
They decided to consult with @SettleMintCom, a blockchain transformation platform, which led to @sonybank_jp integrating @billions_ntwk's zero-knowledge KYC.
And with that, they get:
‚Ä¢ ZK identity verification
‚Ä¢ W3C standard DIDs allowing customers control their credentials
‚Ä¢ On-Chain Verification

Every network breaks at the same point: trust.

Bots scale faster than people. Fake accounts move quicker than real value.
And suddenly, the internet forgets who is human.

@billions_ntwk fixes that at the root.

Not by collecting identities.
Not by exposing data.
But by proving humanity without revealing who you are.

One human.
One cryptographic proof.
Infinite applications  payments, governance, AI, social, finance.

This is not another feature.
It‚Äôs a missing layer the digital world has been waiting for.

When humanity becomes verifiable without becoming visible,
the internet finally scales the right thing.

GM CT üß∏

Billions Network @billions_ntwk is a privacy-first digital identity and verification platform designed for the modern internet  especially Web3 and AI environments. 

Billions Network is essentially:

- A human and AI identity network

- Built around zero-knowledge proofs (ZKPs) a type of cryptography that enables you to prove something (like ‚ÄúI‚Äôm a real human‚Äù) without revealing the underlying information itself. 

- A decentralized identity system where users control their own data on their devices. 

Key Features & Use Cases

- Privacy-Preserving KYC
Users can prove identity for financial apps or Web3 services without handing over sensitive data. 

- Cross-Platform Identity
Through partnerships like with Agglayer (a cross-chain ecosystem), Billions aims to make identity portable across blockchains or apps ‚Äúverify once, use everywhere.‚Äù 

- Sybil Resistance
It helps prevent fake identities and bot accounts in systems like governance, airdrops, and community platforms. 

- Reputation & Rewards
Many users earn points and perks for verification and engagement, building a reputation within the network. 

- AI Trust & Accountability
AI agents can prove their authenticity and operational history, making AI interactions more trustworthy. 

 Why It Matters

- Traditional identity systems often:

- require uploading sensitive documents,

- store data centrally (making it prone to leaks),

- can‚Äôt easily prove real uniqueness,

- struggle in decentralized or cross-chain contexts.

Billions tackles these by combining privacy, decentralization, and usability to create a universal identity layer for the internet of the future.

Now let's know more about Madame Evin McMullen...

ùêÑùê∞ùê¢ùêß ùêåùêúùêåùêÆùê•ùê•ùêûùêß ¬∑ ùêÇùêÑùêé ùêöùêßùêù ùêÇùê®-ùêÖùê®ùêÆùêßùêùùêûùê´ ùê®ùêü ùêÅùê¢ùê•ùê•ùê¢ùê®ùêßùê¨ ùêçùêûùê≠ùê∞ùê®ùê´ùê§

ùêñùê°ùê® ùê¢ùê¨ ùê¨ùê°ùêû?
Evin McMullen is the CEO and co founder of Billions Network, building privacy first human verification for Web3. Her work focuses on the hardest problem online today proving you are human without invasive data collection or centralized control.

ùêÑùêùùêÆùêúùêöùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß ùêöùêßùêù ùêûùêöùê´ùê•ùê≤ ùê≠ùê°ùê¢ùêßùê§ùê¢ùêßùê†
Evin graduated from Yale University, where she studied identity, ownership, and the power dynamics of technology. These ideas now shape how Billions approaches decentralized identity in a practical, real world way.

ùêÅùêûùêüùê®ùê´ùêû ùêÅùê¢ùê•ùê•ùê¢ùê®ùêßùê¨
Before starting Billions, she founded https://t.co/anqcQQhTxe, co founded Privado ID which later merged, and worked on DAO Jones and governance systems. Across these projects, she saw the same pattern identity systems were either invasive, fragile, or overly centralized.

ùêñùê°ùê≤ ùêÅùê¢ùê•ùê•ùê¢ùê®ùêßùê¨ ùêçùêûùê≠ùê∞ùê®ùê´ùê§ ùêûùê±ùê¢ùê¨ùê≠ùê¨?
Most verification today relies on document uploads, permanent biometric storage, or weak CAPTCHAs. Billions was created to replace this with device based zero knowledge proofs that let users verify themselves while keeping full control of their data.

ùêáùê®ùê∞ ùêÅùê¢ùê•ùê•ùê¢ùê®ùêßùê¨ ùê∞ùê®ùê´ùê§ùê¨...
Billions uses zero knowledge proofs to enable proof of humanity without biometrics, central databases, or tracking. The network supports fair token distributions, NFT mints, and sybil resistant apps, with live integrations including AggLayer and Lagrange. No hype, just infrastructure that works.

ùêäùêûùê≤ ùêöùêúùê°ùê¢ùêûùêØùêûùê¶ùêûùêßùê≠ùê¨
Billions has raised $30M from investors including Coinbase Ventures and Polychain Capital. The network has partnered with projects like Sentient (@SentientAGI ) and is active in India on social security fraud prevention use cases. Evin regularly speaks at global conferences such as Devcon and Consensus.

ùêáùêûùê´ ùêØùê¢ùê¨ùê¢ùê®ùêß
A single, reusable verification layer that works across apps, blockchains, and AI agents. A privacy native trust layer for an internet increasingly dominated by bots and deepfakes.

ùêñùê°ùê≤ ùê¢ùê≠ ùê¶ùêöùê≠ùê≠ùêûùê´ùê¨
As AI blurs the line between real and fake, Billions offers a way to rebuild trust without sacrificing privacy. Human centric Web3 starts here.

THIS IS WHY THE OLD MODEL FAILED!!!

The old model assumes trust comes from collecting more information.
So we built KYC flows that force users through the same checks over and over, creating massive databases that attract breaches, lawsuits, and fraud.

Meanwhile, bots slip through
Synthetic identities scale
Real users carry all the risk!!

That model completely collapses in an AI-driven world.

You can‚Äôt KYC an autonomous agent.
You can‚Äôt ask it for documents.
And you definitely can‚Äôt rely on centralized databases when agents operate globally and continuously.

This is where @billions_ntwk gets it right

Instead of storing identities, it enables zero knowledge, on-device verification.
Verify once
Reuse proof everywhere
No biometrics
No centralized database
One human = one identity

Trust without surveillance is not just possible it‚Äôs necessary

Speaking about KYA (Know Your Agent)...

For most of modern software history, tools followed a familiar path.

Builders experimented first.
Enterprises adopted later, once systems were stable, auditable, and safe.

AI agents are now at that same transition point.

They started as experiments.
Small scripts.
Side projects.

Today, they execute actions, interact with users, and increasingly operate inside real economic systems.
But most AI agents are still missing something enterprises require by default.
Clear identity.
Clear ownership.
Clear accountability.

This gap creates tension.

Builders want flexibility and open tools.
Enterprises need security, auditability, and predictable risk.

Know Your Agent, built by Billions Network, is designed to meet both realities at once.

At the builder level, AI agents can generate their own cryptographic identities using the Agent JS SDK, with support for frameworks like LangChain.
These identities are native to the agent, not assigned by a platform.

At the infrastructure level, trust becomes verifiable.
Ownership, audits, and reputation are published through onchain attestations that anyone can independently verify.
No central authority controls trust.

Security is treated as foundational, not optional.
Keys are protected using HSMs, MPC, and protocols like Lit.
Privacy is preserved by design, while auditability remains intact.

This is what makes the system enterprise-ready.

Enterprises can deploy AI agents knowing who owns them, how they behave, and how accountability is enforced without collecting or storing unnecessary personal data.
Builders can ship without locking themselves into closed systems.

That balance matters long term.

As AI agents move from tools to actors, the systems that succeed will be the ones built for production from day one.
Billions Network is building that foundation now, quietly and deliberately, before trust becomes a crisis instead of a design choice.

Telling a newbie what @billions_ntwk is about! 

Billion Network is about fixing the fact that the internet doesn‚Äôt know who or what it‚Äôs talking to anymore.

Right now:
Bots pretend to be people
People run many fake accounts
AI talks like humans without saying it‚Äôs AI
Trust online is basically broken

Billion Network is trying to solve that one problem.

Their idea is simple at the core:
Every human should be able to prove they‚Äôre a real human
Every AI should be clearly known as AI
You shouldn‚Äôt have to give up your personal info to do that

So instead of:
‚ÄúTrust me bro‚Äù
Or uploading your ID everywhere
Or bots flooding systems

You get:
A one-time proof that you‚Äôre real
A way to show that proof anywhere that supports it
Clear separation between humans and machines

They‚Äôre not trying to be a social app.
They‚Äôre not trying to be another Twitter.
They‚Äôre trying to be the layer underneath like plumbing that other apps use so they can stop guessing who‚Äôs real.

If it works, it means:
Less b0t spam
Fairer online systems (votes, rewards, access)
AI that‚Äôs transparent instead of pretending

That‚Äôs it.
No hype talk.
No buzzwords.

Just an attempt to restore trust on the internet in a world full of bots and AI

We've talked about the Know Your Agent (KYA) tech stack that @billions_ntwk is building, but how does it work?

The KYA tech stack is supposed to give AI agents some kind of identity and/or reputation that helps users kind of build trust in them.

‚Ä¢ First, those AI agents get identities, which is done using Agent JS SDK to generate each agent's unique Decentralized Identifiers or DID, which allows the agent to verify itself to humans and other agents.

‚Ä¢ After an Agent gets a DID, humans, organizations, and other agents can start making public attestations about it.
Attestations are permissionless, onchain, and linked to the agent cryptographically. They help potential users get knowledge about the agent to help build trust. Some of the information that can be linked includes:
          ‚Ä£ The agent's authentication
          ‚Ä£ Who owns it (developer or organization)
          ‚Ä£ Who trained it or built it
          ‚Ä£ Who audited it and the results
          ‚Ä£ Reputation signals
These attestations are stored in the Public Attestation Registry on the Billions chain.

‚Ä¢ KYA uses a hybrid trust model by design, which allows the preservation of humans' privacy while still keeping the agent accountable

‚Ä¢ Finally, the reputation of the agent builds over time because of its DID, which is linked to the agent's ownership. So whenever the agent is audited, reputation signals are added, or other agents build or reference an already trusted agent (like when an AI platform uses ChatGPT as its provider), the reputation of the agent grows making it more trustworthy.
